DOC.brief_summary: To investigate the effects of positive end-expiratory pressure (PEEP) on the intracerebral pressure (ICP) and intraocular pressure (IOP) in patients undergoing robot assisted laparoscopic radical prostatectomy (RALRP)
DOC.brief_title: Effects of PEEP on Intracranial and Intraocular Pressure in Robot-assisted Laparoscopic Radical Prostatectomy
DOC.detailed_description: Application of PEEPmay reduce pulmonary complication following RALRP. Meanwhile, it may increase ICP and IOP, which has been debated for decades. Moreover, Trendelenburg position and pneumoperitoneum, which are mandatory for RALRP, may augment elevation of ICP and IOP. This study aims to investigate the effects of PEEP on the ICP and IOP in patients undergoing RALRP.
DOC.criteria: Patients undergoing roboticassisted laparoscopic radical prostatectomy History of opthalmic disease or surgery History of brain disease or surgery Known ICP elevation Known IOP elevation Presence of lung bullae on chest xray History of pneumothorax
